As an early 2000's kid, it was hard to avoid Portal when it was initially released, as all the YouTuber's I regularly watched praised it CONSTANTLY! I was so intrigued by the notorious "cake is a lie" and I REALLY wanted to put my young brain to the test to see if I had what it takes to try and beat a "puzzle" game but alas, I was a Nintendo kid and never had a PC or console that had Portal on it...

BUT! LOOKS WHOSE LAUGHING NOW!!! MWHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!

Honestly, the wait was EXTREMELY worth it and as of now, I LITERALLY can't get this game out of my head! Whether it be this game, it's sequel, or the many mods/fan games, this series has me completely addicted to both its gameplay loop, hunting down achievements, and uncovering the deep lore... (COUGH COUGH* BLACK MESA COUGH COUGH*)

Anyways, this has probably been one of the easiest times I have ever had expressing my absolute love for a game. Thus, Portal has cemented it in my top 10 games of all time!!! (Counting this and Portal 2 as one entry lol)

Portal - 10/10

Portal, despite its age, has lost none of its appeal. It is a puzzle platformer with a very unique and well-known antagonist, great level design and well beyond acceptable visuals. The settings menu features an FOV slider and borderless windowed mode (options not even seen in some modern video games). Also, do yourself a favour and play through Valve's entire catalogue, you won't regret it.

Possibly the most flawless game that I've played, along with the sequel. Though only short, it is a game that will never be forgotten. 

The pacing is perfect - just as familiarity develops with an introduced mechanic, the game introduces something new to refresh the experience. This applies not only to the puzzling, but to the story as well. At the beginning, it seems to be just test chambers with a slightly odd disembodied voice giving instructions. By the end, it has progressed all the way into being a part of the Half Life story. 

Portal is also worth experiencing for its glorious sense of humour.

Absolutely worth playing!
Classic but fantastic puzzle game with good humor
